intro: Cymopterus decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Cymopterus decipiens is known for its ability to attract pollinators with its aromatic foliage and nectar-rich flowers.
